item.title: News24.com | Leaked draft shows US court set to strike down abortion rights: Politico
item.description: The Supreme Court is poised to strike down the right to abortion in the United States, according to a leaked draft of a majority opinion that would shred nearly 50 years of constitutional protections.

item.title: News24.com | Ex-New York cop found guilty of assaulting police during US Capitol riot
item.description: A former New York City police officer was found guilty on Monday of assaulting a Washington, DC, police officer during the 6 January 2021, riot at the US Capitol by supporters of then-President Donald Trump.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Russia is stealing farm equipment and destroying grain silos to cause a famine, Ukraine says
item.description: Ukrainian officials previously accused Russia of stealing grain in areas that President Vladimir Putin's forces now occupy.

item.title: News24.com | Denmark to destroy 1.1 million excess Covid-19 vaccines
item.description: Health agency says it is difficult for Denmark and other EU countries to find recipient countries for the excess doses.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Israel slams top Russian diplomat for suggesting Hitler might have been Jewish
item.description: Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid called Lavrov's comments "unforgivable" and an example of "the lowest form of racism."

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Russian oligarch says he's hired bodyguards after criticising Putin's war in Ukraine
item.description: Oleg Tinkov told The New York Times that he was forced to sell his family's 35% stake in Tinkoff Bank after criticizing the invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: News24.com | WATCH | War in Ukraine: watch all the latest videos as the conflict escalates
News24.com | Europe scrambles for long-term fix after Putin cuts off gas
item.description: European energy providers open Russian rouble accounts for gas, challenging bloc’s united front against Moscow.

item.title: News24.com | 'We have less time to act' - data shows faster sea level rise for New Zealand
item.description: The sea level is rising twice as fast as previously forecast around parts of New Zealand, according to research published Monday, putting the country's two largest cities at risk decades earlier than expected.

item.title: News24.com | US judge rejects RNC request to shelve subpoena against email vendor
item.description: A US federal judge has dismissed a request by the Republican National Committee to block a subpoena asking its email vendor to release records to the congressional panel investigating the 6 January 2021 attack on the US Capitol.

item.title: News24.com | 'Historic moment' - French greens, far-left leader Melenchon strike deal to beat Macron party
item.description: LFI, the movement of far-left leader Jean-Luc Melenchon, has struck a deal with France's green EELV party, politicians from both sides have said.

item.title: News24.com | 'The falling of the Berlin Wall' - company takes down US Confederate statues amid death threats
item.description: Since his contracting company began removing Confederate statues from Richmond, Virginia - controversial symbols of the South's slave-holding past - Devon Henry has got himself a gun.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Naval mines used in Russia's war on Ukraine are starting to float away
item.description: Several naval mines have appeared in other parts of the Black Sea, and "the threat of additional drifting mines cannot be ruled out," NATO says.

item.title: News24.com | Russia not seeking to end Ukraine war by 9 May - Lavrov
item.description: Russia is not looking to end its war in Ukraine by Victory Day on 9 May, its foreign minister has said.

item.title: News24.com | WATCH | Violence erupts in May Day protests in Paris, marchers criticise re-elected Macron
item.description: Police fired tear gas to push back black-clad anarchists who ransacked business premises in the French capital Paris during May Day protests against the policies of newly re-elected President Emmanuel Macron.

item.title: News24.com | 'Don't be bullied', US speaker Pelosi tells Zelensky
item.description: US Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi urged Ukraine not to back down in the face of "bullies" like Russia on Sunday following a surprise weekend visit to Kyiv.

item.title: News24.com | Thousands of Sri Lankans rally over government handling of crisis
item.description: Thousands of supporters of Sri Lankan opposition parties rallied on Sunday in the commercial capital Colombo as a weeks-long political and economic crisis showed no sign of abating.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | China is working to protect its overseas assets amid fears US could impose Russia-style sanctions
item.description: China has offered almost unwavering support for Vladimir Putin following the Russian invasion of Ukraine earlier this year.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | A Russian missile strike damaged the runway of an airport in Odesa, rendering it unusable, Ukraine says
item.description: "The runway at Odesa airport was damaged. Its further use is impossible," Ukraine's military said in a Telegram post on Saturday.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Bill Gates pushes for a new global task force to watch out for future pandemics
item.description: The Microsoft cofounder was pushing countries to take the threat of a global pandemic more seriously long before Covid-19 arrived.
